<JD_START>
Job Title: Starbucks - Barista

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title & Specialty Area: Starbucks - Barista

Department: Food Services

Location: Dallas, TX

Shift: Full-Time

Job Type: On-Site

Why Children’s Health?

At Children's Health, our mission is to Make Life Better for Children, and we recognize that their health plays a crucial role in achieving this goal.

Through our cutting-edge treatments and affiliation with UT Southwestern, we strive to deliver an extraordinary patient and family experience, ensuring that every moment, big or small, contributes to their overall well-being.

Our dedication to promoting children's health extends beyond our organization and encompasses the broader community. Together, we can make a significant difference in the lives of children and contribute to a brighter and healthier future for all.

Summary

This position is responsible for delivering exceptional service and developing expertise in the creation of our products. Within the store environment, this role offers the opportunity to enhance skills in food and beverage preparation. Our baristas play a key role in enhancing each customer's experience. In compliance with store operating policies and standards, this role is responsible for providing quality beverages and food products, cash handling and cleanliness.

Responsibilities

 Prepare food and beverages to standard recipes or customized for customers, including recipe changes such as temperature, quantity of ingredients or substituted ingredients. Enter cost of customer food items into the cash register, give the total customer purchase amount, receive payment, and make change. Balance the cash drawer daily and complete any related paperwork. Maintain cleanliness and neatness of cashier area and serving areas; assist others in keeping lounge area tables/chairs clean. Clean assigned equipment and area as needed. Maintain cleanliness and par level of paper goods and dry goods in retail area. Remove and check expiration dates of all items. Shows a sense of urgency to reduce customer wait times. Other duties as assigned within scope of the role.

Work Experience

 At least 1 year Previous experience involving customer service (Preferred)

EDUCATION

 High school diploma or equivalent (Required)

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS

 Food Handlers Certification 30 Days (Required)

A Place Where You Belong

We put our people first. We welcome, value, and respect the beliefs, identities and experiences of our patients and colleagues. We are committed to delivering culturally effective care, creating meaningful partnerships in the communities we serve, and equipping and developing our team members to make Children’s Health a place where everyone can contribute.

Holistic Benefits – How We’ll Care For You

 Employee portion of medical plan premiums are covered after 3 years. 4%-10% employee savings plan match based on tenure Paid Parental Leave (up to 12 weeks) Caregiver Leave Adoption and surrogacy reimbursement >

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
